message.content:
cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with optimization problems on graphs, specifically the Maximum Acyclic Subgraph problem and its generalization, the Restricted Maximum Acyclic Subgraph problem. These problems are related to graph theory, combinatorics, and algorithms, which are all covered by the cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) sub-category. The paper also discusses approximation algorithms and hardness of approximation, which are topics covered by the cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of linear programming and LP-rounding, which are techniques covered by the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. The paper also has connections to the Vertex Pricing problem, which falls under the cs.CC (Computational Complexity) sub-category. Finally, the paper presents an improved approximation algorithm, which is a topic covered by the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category.
